titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Viscount James Bryce Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Diane E. Kaplan and John Espy

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:41

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of signed manuscripts for the second and third articles of James Bryce's "Impressions of South Africa," which appeared in the Century Illustrated Monthly Magazine in 1896.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Viscount James Bryce Papers (MS 1378). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James Bryce, Viscount Bryce, was born in Belfast in 1838. He studied at Oxford and was called to the bar in 1867. From 1870 to 1893 he was Regius Professor of Civil Law at Oxford. Bryce served in the House of Commons from 1880 until 1906 and was a member of three Cabinets. He was ambassador to the United States from 1907 to 1913. He was created Viscount Bryce in 1914 and served in the House of Lords until his death in 1922. Bryce authored several works on law, history, travel, and foreign policy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of signed manuscripts for the second and third articles of James Bryce's "Impressions of South Africa," which appeared in the Century Illustrated Monthly Magazine in 1896.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Viscount James Bryce Papers consist of two signed manuscripts, the second and third of three articles by Bryce, which appeared under the title "Impressions of South Africa" in the Century Illustrated Monthly Magazine , May-July, 1896. Bryce reprinted the articles in 1897 as a book by the same title.
